abstract: Carl Hulse On Washington column; Sarah Chamberlain, president of Republican Main Street Partnership, announces plans to release Women2Women tour, based on ambitious policy agenda focusing on issues important to female voters; organization, made up of 70 members of House and Senate, recognizes GOP's efforts at garnering votes of female voters have been weak in past and that party could face first female major party nominee for president in Hillary Rodham Clinton.
lead_paragraph: The Republican Main Street Partnership, frustrated at the tone of the party’s presidential candidates, is trying to bring change at the congressional level.

headline.main: An Effort to Give Women a Voice in the Republican Party
headline.print_headline: Back From Tour, Group Plans to Give Women a Bigger Voice in the G.O.P.

snippet: The Republican Main Street Partnership, frustrated at the tone of the party’s presidential candidates, is trying to bring change at the congressional level.
